description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage projects of various size and scope, identifying future opportunities, improving processes and driving the technical directions of your programs.

As a Data Center Field Reliability Technical Program Manager (TPM) will work with cross-functional stakeholders to establish the roadmap for and subsequent execution of field reliability measurements for key Mechanical, Electrical and Power systems in our Data Center infrastructure portfolio to enable consistent feedback to design, supply chain, construction and operations, and increase fleet predictability/performance.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Mechanical, Electrical Engineering, Physics, Materials Science, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 12 years of experience working a quality or reliability engineer in an engineering or operations focused role.
  • 5 years of program management experience.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Masters degree in Mechanical, Electrical Engineering, Physics or Materials Science.
  • ASQ Certifications such as Certified Quality Engineer (CQE), Six Sigma Black Belt (CSSBB), Certified Reliability Engineer (CRE).
  • Experience in reliability modeling, identifying and/or analyzing problems relating to mission critical infrastructure.
  • Experience with Weibull++, JMP, Python, MATLAB, LabVIEW or other programming languages for data analysis.
  • Ability to travel up to 25% of the time to domestic and international locations.
responsibilities:
• Contributing to sourcing new suppliers that meet our reliability expectations (e.g. reliability budgets for equipment).
  • Reviewing supplier’s FMEA, reliability performance, predictive models as part of supplier (re)qualification.
  • Investigating infant mortality failures, recurring reliability issues of field equipment and closing the loop to improve supplier reliability performance.
  • Reviewing reliability test planning during equipment Commissioning/testing to effectively detect infant mortality.
  • Reviewing equipment global, field reliability performance, its CoPQ impact and drive awareness and improvement actions.
title: Data Center Quality Field Reliability Technical Program Manager
